page.title: 07HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content: Old{Orpington} is centred around the {Priory} and the {Saxon church}. Both these buildings are constructed of local flint and stone. A saxon sundial was found when a new extension was being built for the church. The Priory dates from the {12th century}, being a manor house and not a monastic establishment. Today it is the local {museum} and is surrounded by {gardens} and ornamental ponds supplied by {underground springs}. The church was extended in 1957 to cater for the increase in the number of parishoners. Two other large houses were to be found in Orpington, {Bart Hart House} and the {Walnuts}. These houses have now been destroyed to make way for redevelopment.
